page.title: 04PARIS, ASHTON UNDER HILL
page.content: This hamlet, consisting of five residences was probably a settlement from very early times because of the abundance of high quality water arising from the many springs. The name{Paris}dates from the twelfth or thirteenth century when a family named Perys or Parys lived here. There is no French connection. Mole Hill Cottage, an early Tudor, half-timbered thatched structure is the oldest property. Beauchamp House was a mid-nineteenth century building but is now fully modernised and Triona is a modern house built on the site of a small nineteenth century cottage. Pear Tree Cottage was originally two eighteenth century Cotswold stone cottages, now enlarged and partly rebuilt in hand dressed natural stone with Cotswold tiled roof. Bredon Springs completes the colony.
